metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2107 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
The AES-NI implementation in OpenSSL before 1.0.1t and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2h does not consider memory allocation during a certain padding check, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive cleartext information via a padding-oracle attack against an AES CBC session. NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incorrect fix for CVE-2013-0169.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2107` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.19
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.19').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
